headline: United Airlines, American, Delta in focus as Citi boosts targets
summary: Citi analysts have lifted their price targets on several airline stocks, including United Airlines (UAL), American Air (AAL), and Delta (DAL). Market Domination Hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton break down the analyst notes. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: US Senate Panel Blasts Airlines Over 'Junk Fees'
summary: A US Senate panel slammed US airlines over so-called "junk fees" related to seat selection and luggage, multiple media outlets reported Tuesday.

raw.headline: US Senate Panel Blasts Airlines Over 'Junk Fees'
raw.summary: A US Senate panel slammed US airlines over so-called "junk fees" related to seat selection and luggage, multiple media outlets reported Tuesday.

headline: Seat fees are now worth billions for U.S. airlines
summary: If you’ve been annoyed over the last few years that you had to pay to get an assigned seat on a flight, so is the government. The Senate Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations, in one of its last acts before a more business-friendly Republican majority takes over next year, has issued a report criticizing the airline industry’s growing reliance on ancillary fees like seat fees and baggage fees.

headline: Citi lifts price target on airlines, sees boost from premium travel
summary: Investing.com -- U.S. network carriers, including Delta Air Lines Inc (NYSE:DAL), United Airlines, and American Airlines (NASDAQ:AAL), are well-positioned to benefit from a structural shift toward premium travel, according to a Citi note on Monday.

headline: U.S. Airlines Collected More Than $12 Billion From Seat Fees
summary: Fees to select seats have become big business for airlines, according to a Senate subcommittee report.

raw.headline: U.S. Airlines Collected More Than $12 Billion From Seat Fees
raw.summary: Fees to select seats have become big business for airlines, according to a Senate subcommittee report.

headline: US Senate panel criticizes rising airline seat fees, will call execs to testify
summary: A U.S. Senate panel on Tuesday criticized rising airline fees for seat assignments and luggage and will call air carrier executives to testify on Dec. 4.  Senator Richard Blumenthal, who chairs the Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations, will convene a hearing titled  "The Sky’s the Limit -- New Revelations About Airline Fees" with senior executives from American Airlines, United Airlines Delta Air Lines , Spirit Airlines and Frontier to testify.

raw.headline: US Senate panel criticizes rising airline seat fees, will call execs to testify

headline: Airlines make billions charging ‘junk fees,’ congressional report says
summary: Airlines have raked in billions of dollars by charging extra to select a seat and some airlines paid workers incentives to encourage charging more for baggage fees, according to previously undisclosed data in a new Senate subcommittee report﻿.

raw.headline: Airlines make billions charging ‘junk fees,’ congressional report says

headline: A Look Back at Travel and Vacation Providers Stocks’ Q3 Earnings: Marriott Vacations (NYSE:VAC) Vs The Rest Of The Pack
summary: The end of the earnings season is always a good time to take a step back and see who shined (and who not so much). Let’s take a look at how travel and vacation providers stocks fared in Q3, starting with Marriott Vacations (NYSE:VAC).
